page.title: 08CHURCH FARM, AYLMERTON
page.content: A local farm typical of those in North Norfolk, like the one we looked at, covers about 300 hectares. It has been passed through the owner's family. The present farmer has worked here for 30 years. Although 3,000 pigs are kept, they do not take up much land, and sugar beet, wheat and barley were also grown in 1985. The corn is used to feed the pigs, as well as 900 tonnes of other foods bought in. The{Landrace}and {Whitecross pigs}are fattened and sold to Sainsburys Foods. The machinery is much more efficient than 30 years ago. The main items are harvesters, tractors and pig machinery. The buildings are used for the pigs and corn storage. Eight workers are employed on the farm, and they start work at 7.30a.m., finishing at 7.30p.m. (5.30p.m. in winter).
